thread.title: Women battling cancer get free makeover
thread.title_full: Women battling cancer get free makeover

author: 13abc
title: Women battling cancer get free makeover
text:
Related Links More Information SYLVANIA (13abc Action News) - Women battling cancer were given a free makeover on Monday as part of a program called, "Look good, feel better."
Marianne Pappas was one of the women learning makeup tips. In May she was diagnosed with stage one breast cancer, a battle she is still fighting today.
"You don't know how you are going to react or get through it," said Pappas, "but somehow you do."
Pappas is currently undergoing chemotherapy and now wears a wig.
"I was ready for it. We had a party and all of my co-workers took a turn shaving my head."
On Monday, Pappas shed her wig to get a free makeover. It's part of a program an American Cancer Society Program called "Look Good, Feel Better."
"I just don't know how to make myself look the way I would feel comfortable," said Pappas.
During the two hour session, trained cosmetologists gave makeup, hair, and skin care tips, specifically for cancer patients to help disguise the effects of treatment.
"It's about them coming in here and feeling good about themselves. This isn't the end of the world for them and they're going to beat this, and we are going to help them be positive," said cosmetologist, Robin Landres.
At the end of the session, each woman received a free makeup bag filled with $250-worth of products.
